title: Genetic Diversity Exploration Education Using Virtual Laboratories

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Biological Concepts (Cell, Gene, DNA Structure) and Fundamental Understanding of Molecular Biology Experiments
context.additional_context: Graduate-level education program for working professionals, providing flexible learning through personal devices; strengthens scientific concept explanation skills through integration with language courses

learning_goals: Learners can analyze genetic variation among organisms through virtual lab simulations and explain the impact of electrophoresis results on biodiversity.
Learners can write a project report quantitatively comparing genetic diversity within a population using DNA fingerprinting techniques.
Learners can argue the ecological significance of genetic diversity by connecting biological concepts across molecular, cellular, organismal, and population levels.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
